arm_group.description: Full-term neonates at 2 weeks of age born to lean mothers
Full-term neonates at two weeks of age born of obese mothers

brief_summary.textblock:
The specific aim of this study is to use MRI methods to evaluate and compare brain structure
      and function in two groups of full-term neonates at two-weeks of age: those born of obese
      mothers and those born to lean mothers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Maternal Body Composition on Offspring Brain Structure and Function

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  the participant must be enrolled in the Arkansas Children's Nutrition Center (ACNC)
             Glowing study and be about 2 weeks of age +/- 3days

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none specified

study_pop.textblock:
Full term neonates born from obese or lean mothers enrolled in the Glowing study
        (IRB#110889)

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Maternal Body Composition on Offspring Brain Structure and Function

primary_outcome.description: We will use high resolution volumetric magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and Diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) to measure the brain structure of 2 week old infants

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: We will use high resolution Resting state functional magnetic resonance imaging (rsfMRI) to measure the brain function of 2 week old infants

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
